qas.question: What is the name of the IBM project that redirected $1 billion each year to increase energy efficiency?
Secure Blue was launched in what year?
What type of hardware is Secure Blue?
Who was the IBM ceo in November 2008?
What framework did IBM announce on March 1, 2011?
How much did it cost for IBM to produce Secure Blue?

plausible_answers.text: at the Council on Foreign Relations

qas.question: Where did Sam Palmisano make a speech in 2006?
What agenda was presented by von Neumann in 2006 at the Council on Foreign Relations?

plausible_answers.text: chips that imitate neurons and synapses

qas.question: What kind of chips were created by Smarter Computing in 2006?
What kind of framework was announced by von Neumann in 2006?

context: In <a1_0>2006<a1_0/>, IBM launched Secure Blue, <a2_0>encryption hardware<a2_0/> that can be built into microprocessors. A year later, IBM unveiled <a0_0>Project Big Green<a0_0/>, a re-direction of <b5_0>$1 billion<b5_0/> per year across its businesses to increase energy efficiency. On November 2008, IBM’s CEO, <a3_0>Sam Palmisano<a3_0/>, during a speech <b6_0>at the Council on Foreign Relations<b6_0/>, outlined a new agenda <b7_0>for building a Smarter Planet<b7_0/>. On March 1, 2011, IBM announced the <a4_0><b9_0>Smarter Computing framework<b9_0/><a4_0/> to support Smarter Planet. On Aug 18, 2011, as part of its effort in cognitive computing, IBM has produced <b8_0>chips that imitate neurons and synapses<b8_0/>. These microprocessors do not use von Neumann architecture, and they consume less memory and power.
